Alright, so when I originally got the game on Steam I had already been playing it on PS4 for a bit. I genuinely do enjoy the game, though there are problems with the player base that need to be addressed. With Dead By Daylight, just like with every other multiplayer game that you will ever play, there are toxic people in the game and community. A lot of the time unless you find a chill killer, you will be camped while on the hook. The perks you can use, and the tools you can bring into game with you is very vital to counter the killer. There are people who aren't team players in the game, but hey, that's gaming in a nutshell for you. If you are interested in the game, I 100% recommend you not only watch videos on it online, but also watch people stream it. The perks and bloodweb can be complicated for new players, but I promise it's not as complicated as it looks. I recommend the game to people who are looking into buying it. I hope you guys have fun when you do inevitably buy it, and I hope to see you guys in a lobby :)

First and foremost, let me say this review comes from the perspective of a more casual gamer. I'm not very skilled at games, and I originally only got this to play custom games with my friends. Since then, however, I have definitely gotten "hooked". Get it? Hooked? See what I did there? (Yes I am corny)

What I can say about Dead by Daylight is it's a game with a simple concept, a very interesting mechanic in the 1 v 4 asymmetrical point of views (which is what piqued my interest initially), but with a level of depth and strategy that surprised me. With approaching 200 different types of total perks to benefit survivors and killers, add ons that can sometimes really change a character's play style, and a nice variety of maps that make you adapt your strategy a bit (I'll never put in the sheer number of hours that makes all the maps more routine), the game is so much more than hack and slash or run away. While there are meta builds and tier lists and such for everything in this game, I think the beauty is it's not necessarily "you need to run this setup or else you're not going to succeed" because perks that top tier players don't benefit from are ones that might help noobs like me.

Therein lies the challenge the developers have in this game, and where I think some of the sometimes unfair criticism comes from. It is exceptionally difficult to keep a game balanced when there is such a wide skill gap in the community. It will never be perfect, but from my perspective, it feels like they, for the most part, have done a very good job. I don't usually like playing in public lobbies, but I gave it a go and was actually surprised how I've been inclined to play more. I think the lack of ability to communicate really curtails the ability to encounter toxic people, and while there will be the occasional unbalanced game due to the skill level of a killer being way above/below the survivors, I feel more often than not that the games are fair and fun.

Expanding upon that, the scoring system in the game has made me increasingly appreciate they way they constructed the game. The fact that there is no concrete definition of a "win" or a "loss" I think partially minimizes some of the people who might otherwise play solely prioritizing a public facing W-L record. You instead accumulate Bloodpoints in a number of categories, which encourages variety in your type of gameplay, which in turn leads to some longer and more balanced games. How you perform in each category influences how you rank up. I really grew to appreciate this as I understood how they structured things, and consequently it has led to some funny interactions where a killer may play around and drop you off at an escape hatch instead of just mercilessly killing you.

So what are some downsides? Well, it's not what I would consider pay to win or unfaily priced by any stretch of the imagination, but people who have already invested heavy hours will come with a pretty distinct perk advantage and have more tools at their disposal to succeed. Grinding definitely can help you to unlock new perks/characters, but as I stated, I am a casual gamer. I don't feel the need to do this, and you don't at all need anything fancy to still have an enjoyable time playing at the lower ranks of the game (and custom games with your friends have all the perks and add ons unlocked, which is nice). The only other thing that I think would be nice is sort of a solo, open map mode where you can just learn mechanics of the characters. I don't think it's fair to anyone if you're just forced into a public game using a character like the Nurse, whose entire gameplay revolves around teleportation that requires a good amount of practice to understand how far you travel, chaining together blinks, etc. Why not allow people an area to learn mechanics outside of a game instead of wasting everyone's time in an uncompetitive match where no one has fun?

Overall, I thought it was fitting to offer the perspective of a mediocre gamer who usually hates playing games in public lobbies and provide some reassurance that gamers like me can still get a lot of fun and enjoyment out of this game.

Same problem as every only game, the higher you go in rank the more hackers you see. Rage quit vs a speed hacker and wall hack, you get punished by losing blood points and you have to wait to re queue. Meanwhile hackers are roaming free in the game. This game has potential, the people playing it don't. If you want to buy it, wait until it is on sale or get it for free with xbox pass or playstation plus.

Archive requires you to buy extra characters to complete, just check youtube for it if you are interested, do not waste your money on this game.

Крутая атмосферная игра, советую, особенно с друзьями)))
Плюсы:
+ Графика на хорошем уровне.
+ Много персонажей из известных всеми выдуманных вселенных например Фреди/Немезис/Бубба и тд.
+ Много возможностей стратегии игры.
+ Игра интересна для людей разного гендера и возраста. 
+ Эмоциональная игра, испугать/рассмешить может даже опытных игроков.
+ Постоянное добавление нового контента манов/сурвов/одежды/карты.
+ обеспечит вам и вашим друзьям (до 5 человек) веселье не меньше чем на 1000 часов
   (дальше киберспорт, задротство и фрустрация)
Минусы:
- Простая механика победы, со временем надоедает.
- Подбор рангов частенько несправедлив .
- Сурвы могут получить огромное преимущество играя в пати (в четвером).
- "читерная несправедливость" с которой слабо противодействуют, у каждого второго: конфиги на моник(для лучшего обзора), чит на все предметы/одежду/персов/перки/убер престиж/подношения, читы на игровой процесс блок мана/скорость/лагсвич и тд.
- самое токсичное комьюнити в мире, постоянно диктуют как и что вам делать, есть неофициальные(антитоксичные) правила поведения для мана/сурва, но на самом деле игрой не запрещено, так что можно играть как хочешь))).
- встречаются несправедливые баги игры, проблемы с застреванием/колизией/хитами/лагами.

as a sort of beginner i can definitely say that this game is FUN. most of the time you get into good matches, where there arent super bad people, and there arent super good people, and its a perfect game. thats only sometimes though, other times you go against level 1's who flashlight spam you, body block you, and then you realize. im more afraid of them then they are of me, if you are a level 5 trapper who clearly just started the game, you will be TOURMENTED by claudettes and flashlight. so be warned, starting out is rough af. but playing this game and beating the toxic people is some of the most rewarding feelings ever, so that is why i recomend this game

This game is great. And its even better with friends. Although yes its grindy, but they always release events that are 2x bloodpoints or something like that, so really there no excuse other than you're just lazy. Its a cat and mouse chase type game with many classic licensed killers, and original killers if that's your thing. Yes there's sweaty and toxic players, but that's with every game. So there's no excuse not to try it.
